title: Tech Down After Blacklisting Of Chinese Cos — Tech Roundup
text:
The technology sector fell after the U.S. decision to add 28 Chinese companies to its trade blacklist, saying their technology is being used to repress China's Muslim groups.

Some of the companies affected, which reportedly include Hikvision and Dahua, are key to China's ambitions in artificial intelligence advances. In an illustration of the ripple effects of the trade war, shares of U.S. chip maker Ambarella, which supplies Chinese developers of facial recognition and AI, fell sharply.

Sony Corp. said it would release its next-generation videogame console, called the PlayStation 5, in time for the year-end shopping season in 2020.

Oracle said it plans to hire roughly 2,000 employees in locations including Northern California and India, as part of a cloud-computing push. Activision Blizzard suspended an esports competitor from one of its tournaments for backing antigovernment protesters in Hong Kong as tensions intensify between Beijing and the National Basketball Association over a similar expression of support.
